wikipedia_page.main: Sir Richard Morris Dane  (1854–1940) was a British administrator in  India and China.

response: He was born on 21 March 1856 at Chichester, Sussex the fifth son of Richard Martin Dane, an army staff surgeon, and Sophia Eliza, the daughter of Colonel Charles Griffiths who had served in the First Anglo-Afghan War.  Richard Morris Dane, was his brother. He was educated at Dr Stackpole's school in Kingstown, Dublin and passed his examinations for the Indian Civil Service in 1874.  He was married to Edith Norman on 3 March 1882.
*Richard Morris Dane, Esq, Indian Civil Service.
